title: Provides for funding of early intervention services
summary: Provides for state grant funding to municipalities for early intervention services for toddlers with disabilities and their families.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  public health law, in relation to funding early
         intervention services; to amend chapter  639  of  the  laws  of  1996,
         constituting  the  Health Care Reform Act of 1996 and chapter 1 of the
         laws of 1999, constituting the New York  Health  Care  Reform  Act  of
         2000,  in  relation  to extending provisions of such chapters relating
         thereto

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  public health law is amended by adding a new section
    2  2807-o to read as follows:
    3    S 2807-O.  EARLY  INTERVENTION  SERVICES  POOL.  1.  DEFINITIONS.  THE
    4  FOLLOWING  WORDS  OR  PHRASES  AS  USED  IN  THIS SECTION SHALL HAVE THE
    5  FOLLOWING MEANINGS:
    6    (A) "EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES" SHALL MEAN SERVICES DELIVERED TO  AN
    7  ELIGIBLE  CHILD, PURSUANT TO AN INDIVIDUALIZED FAMILY SERVICE PLAN UNDER
    8  THE EARLY INTERVENTION PROGRAM.
    9    (B) "EARLY INTERVENTION PROGRAM" SHALL  MEAN  THE  EARLY  INTERVENTION
   10  PROGRAM  FOR TODDLERS WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES AS CREATED BY
   11  TITLE TWO-A OF ARTICLE TWENTY-FIVE OF THIS CHAPTER.
   12    (C) "MUNICIPALITY" SHALL MEAN ANY COUNTY OUTSIDE OF THE  CITY  OF  NEW
   13  YORK OR THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
   14    2. GRANTS FOR EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES. (A) THE COMMISSIONER SHALL,
   15  FROM FUNDS ALLOCATED FOR SUCH PURPOSE UNDER PARAGRAPH (G) OF SUBDIVISION
   16  SIX OF SECTION TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED SEVEN-S OF THIS ARTICLE, MAKE GRANTS

                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1  TO  MUNICIPALITIES FOR THE DELIVERY OF EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES. SUCH
    2  GRANTS SHALL BE DEEMED REIMBURSEMENT FROM THIRD  PARTY  PAYORS  TO  SUCH
    3  MUNICIPALITIES FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE EARLY INTERVENTION PROGRAM.
    4    (B)  GRANTS  UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE AWARDED TO MUNICIPALITIES
    5  BY THE COMMISSIONER. EACH MUNICIPALITY SHALL RECEIVE  A  SHARE  OF  SUCH
    6  GRANTS  EQUAL TO ITS PROPORTIONATE SHARE OF THE TOTAL APPROVED STATEWIDE
    7  DOLLARS NOT REIMBURSABLE BY  THE  MEDICAL  ASSISTANCE  PROGRAM  PAID  TO
    8  PROVIDERS  OF EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES BY MUNICIPALITIES, NOT INCLUD-
    9  ING PROVIDERS  OF  TRANSPORTATION,  ON  ACCOUNT  OF  EARLY  INTERVENTION
   10  SERVICES,  IN THE LAST COMPLETE STATE FISCAL YEAR FOR WHICH SUCH DATA IS
   11  AVAILABLE.
   12    S 2. Subdivision 6 of section 2807-s  of  the  public  health  law  is
   13  amended by adding two new paragraphs (g) and (h) to read as follows:
   14    (G)  A FURTHER GROSS STATEWIDE AMOUNT FOR TWO THOUSAND TWELVE SHALL BE
   15  ONE HUNDRED MILLION DOLLARS.
   16    (H) THE AMOUNT SPECIFIED IN PARAGRAPH (G) OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE
   17  ALLOCATED AMONG THE MUNICIPALITIES BASED ON EACH MUNICIPALITY'S SHARE OF
   18  EARLY INTERVENTION PROGRAM EXPENDITURES NOT REIMBURSABLE BY THE  MEDICAL
   19  ASSISTANCE  PROGRAM  FOR  THE  LATEST TWELVE MONTH PERIOD FOR WHICH SUCH
   20  DATA IS AVAILABLE.
   21    S 3. Subdivision 7 of section 2807-s  of  the  public  health  law  is
   22  amended by adding a new paragraph (d) to read as follows:
   23    (D)  FUNDS  SHALL  BE ADDED TO THE FUNDS COLLECTED BY THE COMMISSIONER
   24  FOR DISTRIBUTION IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED SEVEN-O
   25  OF THIS ARTICLE, IN THE FOLLOWING AMOUNT:  ONE HUNDRED  MILLION  DOLLARS
   26  FOR THE PERIOD JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE THROUGH DECEMBER THIR-
   27  TY-FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE.
   28    S  4.  Subdivision  1  and  paragraphs (j) and (k) of subdivision 4 of
   29  section 2557 of the public health  law,  subdivision  1  as  amended  by
   30  section  4 of part C of chapter 1 of the laws of 2002 and paragraphs (j)
   31  and (k) of subdivision 4 as amended by section 7 of part B3  of  chapter
   32  62 of the laws of 2003, are amended to read as follows:
   33    1. The approved costs for an eligible child who receives an evaluation
   34  and early intervention services pursuant to this title shall be a charge
   35  upon  the  municipality wherein the eligible child resides or, where the
   36  services are covered by the medical assistance program, upon the  social
   37  services  district of fiscal responsibility with respect to those eligi-
   38  ble children who are also eligible for medical assistance. All  approved
   39  costs  shall be paid in the first instance and at least quarterly by the
   40  appropriate governing body or officer of the municipality upon  vouchers
   41  presented  and  audited  in  the same manner as the case of other claims
   42  against the municipality. Notwithstanding the  insurance  law  or  regu-
   43  lations thereunder relating to the permissible exclusion of payments for
   44  services under governmental programs, no such exclusion shall apply with
   45  respect  to  payments  made  pursuant to this title. Notwithstanding the
   46  insurance law or any other law or agreement to  the  contrary,  benefits
   47  under this title shall be considered secondary to any [plan of insurance
   48  or]  state  government benefit program under which an eligible child may
   49  have coverage. [Nothing in this section shall increase or enhance cover-
   50  ages provided for within an insurance contract subject to the provisions
   51  of this title.]
   52    (j) The number of children that [have third party  reimbursement]  ARE
   53  COVERED BY THE MEDICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM;
   54    (k) The number of claims submitted to [third party payors] THE MEDICAL
   55  ASSISTANCE  PROGRAM  by municipality. The percentage of claims denied by

       A. 812                              3

    1  [third party payors] THE MEDICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. The reasons for the
    2  denials.
    3    S  5. Subdivision 2 of section 2557 of the public health law, as added
    4  by chapter 428 of the laws of 1992, is amended to read as follows:
    5    2. The department shall reimburse the approved costs paid by a munici-
    6  pality for the purposes of this title, other than those reimbursable  by
    7  the  medical assistance program [or by third party payors], in an amount
    8  of fifty percent of the amount expended in accordance with the rules and
    9  regulations of the commissioner. Such state reimbursement to the munici-
   10  pality shall not be paid prior to April first of the year in  which  the
   11  approved costs are paid by the municipality.
   12    S  6. The section heading of section 2559 of the public health law, as
   13  added by chapter 428 of the laws of 1992, is amended to read as follows:
   14    [Third  party  insurance  and  medical]  MEDICAL  assistance   program
   15  payments.
   16    S  7. Subdivision 3 of section 2559 of the public health law, as added
   17  by chapter 428 of the laws of 1992, paragraph (a) as amended  and  para-
   18  graph  (d)  as  added  by chapter 231 of the laws of 1993, is amended to
   19  read as follows:
   20    3. (a) Providers of early  intervention  services  and  transportation
   21  services  shall in the first instance and where applicable, seek payment
   22  from [all  third  party  payors  including  governmental  agencies]  THE
   23  MEDICAL  ASSISTANCE PROGRAM prior to claiming payment from a given muni-
   24  cipality for services rendered to eligible children, provided that,  for
   25  the  purpose  of seeking payment from the medical assistance program [or
   26  from other third party payors], the municipality  shall  be  deemed  the
   27  provider  of  such  early  intervention  services to the extent that the
   28  provider  has  promptly  furnished  to  the  municipality  adequate  and
   29  complete  information necessary to support the municipality billing, and
   30  provided further that the obligation to seek payment shall not apply [to
   31  a payment from a third party payor who is not prohibited  from  applying
   32  such  payment,  and  will  apply  such payment, to an annual or lifetime
   33  limit specified in the insured's policy] WHERE THE INSURED IS NOT ELIGI-
   34  BLE FOR MEDICAL ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE SOCIAL SERVICES LAW.
   35    (b) [The commissioner, in consultation with the director of budget and
   36  the superintendent of insurance, shall promulgate regulations  providing
   37  public  reimbursement  for  deductibles and copayments which are imposed
   38  under an insurance policy or health benefit plan to the extent that such
   39  deductibles  and  copayments  are  applicable  to   early   intervention
   40  services.
   41    (c)  Payments  made for early intervention services under an insurance
   42  policy or health benefit plan which are provided  as  part  of  an  IFSP
   43  pursuant  to  section twenty-five hundred forty-five of this title shall
   44  not be applied by the insurer or plan administrator against any  maximum
   45  lifetime  or  annual  limits  specified in the policy or health benefits
   46  plan, pursuant to section eleven of the chapter of the laws of  nineteen
   47  hundred ninety-two which added this title.
   48    (d)]  A  municipality,  or  its  designee, shall be subrogated, to the
   49  extent of the expenditures by such municipality for  early  intervention
   50  services furnished to persons eligible for benefits under this title, to
   51  any  rights  such  person  may  have or be entitled to from [third party
   52  reimbursement] THE MEDICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.  The right of subrogation
   53  does not attach to benefits paid or provided [under any health insurance
   54  policy or health benefits plan] prior to receipt of  written  notice  of
   55  the exercise of subrogation rights [by the insurer or plan administrator
   56  providing such benefits].  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY INCONSISTENT PROVISION OF

    1  THIS  TITLE,  EXCEPT  AS PROVIDED FOR HEREIN, NO THIRD PARTY PAYOR OTHER
    2  THAN THE MEDICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM SHALL BE REQUIRED TO  REIMBURSE  FOR
    3  EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES PROVIDED UNDER THIS TITLE.

   34  provided  before  December 31, [2011] 2014, and continued expenditure of

   36  therefor;
   37    S  10. This act shall take effect immediately; provided, however, that
   38  sections one through seven of this act  shall  take  effect  January  1,
   39  2012;  provided,  further,  that the amendments to section 2807-s of the
   40  public health law made by sections two and three of this act  shall  not
   41  affect  the  expiration  of  such  section and shall be deemed to expire
   42  therewith.
